title: Qurbani / Udhiya
excerpt: As Eid Al Adha approaches, embrace the sacred act of Udhiya by sharing your blessings with families in need across Africa. For many, your Qurbani donation may be their only chance all year to enjoy a nourishing meal with meat.

contents.body: Celebrate Udhiya During Eid Al Adha

The sacred occasion of Qurbani/Udhiya during Eid Al Adha is almost upon us, marking not only the best time to celebrate with your loved ones but also the perfect opportunity to manifest your devotion to Allah (SWT). It’s a time to actively participate in the act of Qurbani, sharing your blessings with those in need and embodying the spirit of generosity and gratitude.
For many families across Africa, Eid Al Adha represents a unique moment of joy and gratitude, primarily because of the Udhiya donations from generous individuals like you.

This sacred occasion might be the only time of the year they’ll get to enjoy a meal that contains meat, a rare luxury brought directly by your kindness. Through Udhiya in Africa, donors are making a tangible difference, allowing children and families to partake in a delicious and nutritious meal, possibly for the very first time.
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, “No good deeds done on other days are superior to those done on these (first ten days of Dhul Hijjah).”

As we’re approaching Dhul Hijjah, make the first days of the “Month of the Pilgrimage” count. Even if you can’t fulfill your Hajj duty, there are many ways to reap the immense blessings of this sacred month.
Donating to those in need is your direct pathway to gain great rewards.

At Africa Relief, we channel your generous donations to empower vulnerable communities across Africa. It’s the best time of the year to support our projects – Water is Life, Food Aid, Orphan Care, Education, Healthcare, Islamic Giving, Emergency Response.

You don’t only earn your protection from punishment this month. You can also celebrate the day Allah (SWT) perfected his religion, completed His favors upon His beloved Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), and approved Islam as a way of life—the Day of Arafah. Make the most of it by helping those in need have a decent life.
